title: AgentRM: Enhancing Agent Generalization with Reward Modeling
author: Yu Xia (Tsinghua University), Jingru Fan (Tsinghua University), Weize Chen (Tsinghua University), Siyu Yan (Tsinghua University), Xin Cong (Tsinghua University), Zhong Zhang (Tsinghua University), Yaxi Lu (Tsinghua University), Yankai Lin (Tsinghua University), Zhiyuan Liu (Tsinghua University), Maosong Sun (Tsinghua University)
relevance_why: The paper introduces techniques for generalization in language model agents that could enhance performance in audio-related tasks, especially in generating or interpreting complex audio data with contextual understanding.
background: The paper discusses improving the generalization of language model agents in unseen tasks using a reward modeling approach.
contribution: AgentRM introduces a generalizable reward model to enhance the decision-making ability of policy models in agent tasks, achieving an average improvement of 8.8 points over baseline models.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily focused on multi-task fine-tuning, which improved held-in task specific performance but often degraded unseen task performance.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work establishes that finetuning a reward model instead of the policy model directly is a more robust approach for enhancing generalization.

key_innovation: The unique integration of three different reward modeling approaches to improve the selection process in decision-making enhances both specializability and generalizability of the policies.
real_world_impact: This could lead to more versatile and capable AI agents in various applications like virtual assistants or automated systems handling real-world tasks effectively.
limitations: The methodology is limited to a few agent tasks due to data constraints and does not explore broader task settings.

new_terms.agent tasks: **Agent tasks** refer to interactive tasks where an agent must take actions within an environment based on observations and instructions to achieve specific goals.
new_terms.Best-of-N sampling: **Best-of-N sampling** is a technique where multiple candidate outputs are generated, allowing for selection based on quality or fitness according to some metric, in this case guided by a reward model.

open_sourcing: Codes will be released to facilitate the research in this area.
